pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.4: 2. The second training rule on acknowledgment
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.2: At that time, when families invited monks to meals,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.3: the nuns from the group of six were directing people toward the monks from the group of six, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.5: The monks from the group of six ate as much as they wanted,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.6: but not so the other monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.7: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.8: “How could the monks from the group of six not restrain the nuns from giving directions?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you didn’t do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.12: “Foolish men, how could you not do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1: ‘When monks eat by invitation to families, if a nun is there giving directions, saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice there,” then those monks should stop her: “Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating.” If not even a single monk addresses that nun in this way to stop her, they must acknowledge it:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.16: “We have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which is to be acknowledged. We acknowledge it.”’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.1: When monks eat by invitation to families:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.2: a family: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.4: eat any of the five cooked foods by invitation.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.6: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8: saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice there,” according to friendship, according to companionship, according to who one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil—this is called “giving directions”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.12: the nun who is giving directions.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.13: Those monks should stop her: ‘Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating’:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14: if she is not stopped by even one monk, and a monk then receives food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.15: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.1: If she is fully ordained, and he perceives her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.2: If she is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.3: If she is fully ordained, but he does not perceive her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.4: If he does not restrain a nun who is fully ordained only on one side from giving directions, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.5: If the person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.6: If the person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.7: If the person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.2: if a nun does not give it herself, but gets someone else to give her own food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.3: if a nun does not get someone else to give it, but she gives someone else’s food herself;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.4: if a nun gets someone else to give what has not yet been given;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.5: if a nun gets someone else to give to someone who has not yet received anything;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.6: if a nun gets someone else to give equally to all;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.7: if a trainee nun is giving directions;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.8: if a novice nun is giving directions;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.9: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of cooked food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.12: The second training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
